Physical Exam: General inspection of the skin and sclera for jaundice
Justification: To assess the extent of jaundice and identify any other skin changes.
To check for tenderness, organomegaly, or any masses that may indicate liver or gallbladder issues.
To listen for bowel sounds and assess for any abnormal sounds that may indicate gastrointestinal issues.
To assess for any other signs of liver disease, such as Kayser-Fleischer rings or other abnormalities.
To evaluate for signs of dehydration, which can occur with jaundice and decreased appetite.

Physical Exam: Vital signs measurement (temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure)
Justification: To establish a baseline and check for any signs of infection or systemic illness.
